item.title: Hanisha add a quote by Neal Stephenson
item.description: "Until a man is twenty-five, he still thinks, every so often, that under the right circumstances he could be the baddest motherfucker in the world. If I moved to a martial-arts monastery in China and studied real hard for ten years. If my family was wiped out by Colombian drug dealers and I swore myself to revenge. If I got a fatal disease, had one year to live, and devoted it to wiping out street crime. If I just dropped out and devoted my life to being bad." -- Neal Stephenson

item.title: Hanisha add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "As my father always used to tell me, 'You see, son, there's always someone in the world worse off than you.' And I always used to think, 'So?" -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Hanisha add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "We used to build civilizations. Now we build shopping malls." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Hanisha add a quote by John Greenleaf Whittier
item.description: "Of all sad words of tongue or pen, the saddest are these, 'It might have been." -- John Greenleaf Whittier

item.title: Hanisha add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Hanisha add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Hanisha add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description:
"Curious things, habits. People themselves never knew they had them.
[Witness for the Prosecution, also published in The Hound of Death and Other Stories.]" -- Agatha Christie
